meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of friars.
meanings.sent1: The friarly robes were simple and brown.
meanings.sent2: The friarly man had a kind smile and gentle demeanor.
meanings.sent3: The friarly cat seemed to have taken a vow of silence.
meanings.sent4: Her friarly dedication to helping others was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The friarly atmosphere of the monastery was peaceful and serene.

meanings.definition: In the manner of a friar.
meanings.sent1: He walked friarly through the garden, his hands folded in prayer.
meanings.sent2: She spoke friarly, with a calm and soothing voice.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail friarly, as if blessing everyone it met.
meanings.sent4: The old man moved friarly, as if carrying the weight of the world on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The wind whispered friarly through the trees, carrying messages of peace.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to a friar or friars.
meanings.sent1: The friarly duties included prayer, meditation, and helping the needy.
meanings.sent2: The friarly community welcomed all with open arms.
meanings.sent3: The friarly garden was filled with herbs and flowers used for healing.
meanings.sent4: Her friarly kindness touched the hearts of everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The friarly lifestyle emphasized simplicity, humility, and service to others.
